form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Coburn(for himself andMr. Udall of Colorado) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to theCommittee on Rules and Administration

form.official-title: To prevent the creation of duplicative and overlapping Federal programs.

section.text: This resolution may be cited as the Preventing Duplicative and Overlapping Government Programs Resolution .
Paragraph 11 of rule XXVI of the Standing Rules of the Senate is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraph (c) and subparagraph (d); and
by inserting after subparagraph (b) the following:

subsection.text: The report accompanying each bill or joint resolution of a public character reported by any committee (including theCommittee on Appropriationsand theCommittee on the Budget) shall contain—

paragraph.text: an analysis by theCongressional Research Serviceto determine if the bill or joint resolution creates any new Federal program, office, or initiative that would duplicate or overlap any existing Federal program, office, or initiative with similar mission, purpose, goals, or activities along with a listing of all of the overlapping or duplicative Federal program or programs, office or offices, or initiative or initiatives; and

an explanation provided by the committee as to why the creation of each new program, office, or initiative is necessary if a similar program or programs, office or offices, or initiative or initiatives already exist.

section.text: Rule XVII of the Standing Rules of the Senate is amended by inserting at the end thereof the following:

subsection.text: It shall not be in order in theSenateto proceed to any bill or joint resolution unless the committee of jurisdiction has prepared and posted on the committee website an overlapping and duplicative programs analysis and explanation for the bill or joint resolution as described in subparagraph (b) prior to proceeding.
The analysis and explanation required by this subparagraph shall contain—

paragraph.text: an analysis by theCongressional Research Serviceto determine if the bill or joint resolution creates any new Federal program, office, or initiative that would duplicate or overlap any existing Federal program, office, or initiative with similar mission, purpose, goals, or activities along with a listing of all of the overlapping or duplicative Federal program or programs, office or offices, or initiative or initiatives; and

an explanation provided by the committee as to why the creation of each new program, office, or initiative is necessary if a similar program or programs, office or offices, or initiative or initiatives already exist.

subsection.text: This paragraph may be waived by joint agreement of theMajority Leaderand theMinority Leader of the Senateupon their certification that such waiver is necessary as a result of—

paragraph.text: an emergency as determined by the leaders.
